definition[0]: not less than a particular number or amount
example[0]: It will take you at least 20 minutes to get there.
example[1]: He had at least £100,000 in savings.
example[2]: It would cost $1 million at the very least.
definition[1]: even if something better is not true or is not done
example[3]: At least he didn’t lie to me.
example[4]: I don’t expect you to pay me, but you could at least cover my expenses.
example[5]: The house still needed a lot of work, but at least the kitchen was finished.
definition[2]: used when you are correcting or changing something that you have just said
example[6]: They all knew I was on their side. At least, that’s what they said.
example[7]: I made everything perfectly clear – or at least I thought I did.
